TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void UploadDataCompletedEventHandler(object sender, UploadDataCompletedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed UploadDataCompletedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the <xref:System.Net.WebClient.UploadDataCompleted> event of a <xref:System.Net.WebClient>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When you create a UploadDataCompletedEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates asynchronously uploading data.
[!code-cpp[NCLWebClientAsync#34](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.uploaddatac_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NCLWebClientAsync#34](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.uploaddatac_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[NCLWebClientAsync#34](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.net.uploaddatac_0_1.vb)]
The following method is called when the upload completes.
